h_comment: Not 5 star. Pool not available from 6.00 each night due to hiring out to weddings. Lifts were terrible with long waits of 15 minutes. Plus they reserve one of them for wedding guests. Pool area not well laid out can probably hold 30 people at most.  Pool is also not heated and no jacuzzi.  Bathroom had mould and fridge didnâ€™t work. Staff canâ€™t speak English so trying to resolve any issue is a waste of time. Find somewhere else with a decent pool and you will get better value for money. Disappointed in our time here given the price

h_title_comment: A modern and well located hotel in Ho Chi Minh City
h_comment: My family spent 5 nights at La Vela Saigon Hotel in December 2022 while I spent only one. However, it was enough to make my mind on the place. La Vela Saigon Hotel is a good option for a stay in Ho Chi Minh City. The room was spacious with a modern decoration and was very clean and well appointed. It had expansive views over the city. The breakfast buffet was also very good with plenty of options. The rooftop pool is fantastic and offers a stunning panorama over the city. However, there was a nagging issue during the whole stay, elevators. We had to spend sometimes close to 10 minutes waiting for an elevator. Beautiful art in hotel, with disappointing service. The hotel is run down. 1 out of the 4 elevators are not working. You wait forever to get an elevator. I've stayed at incredible hotels around the world and across Vietnam. This was the biggest disappointment. Do not get the corner room, as I literally had to pee sideways to fit. I ordered a mushroom pizza and they used canned mushrooms. Not sure why, when everywhere else in Vietnam had gorgeous variety of fresh mushrooms. Pool area, gorgeous pool but had to wait 45 minutes to get service and they still got it wrong. Then, I had to ask them twice to come pick up my bags, after waiting 25 minutes, I ended up bringing my own luggage downstairs. At 6:30am, they were all just sitting there. h_title_comment: A good hotel, but could be better for a 5*
h_comment: We stayed from 29 Dec 2022 to 1 Jan 2023.  The good points: - the reception area and floors with rooms were clean and spacious - gym is well equipped - cocktails by the pool are tasty - NYE countdown party was brilliant, with great packages for guests (including a good selection of food and wine) and good entertainment  The areas for improvement (considering this is a 5* hotel): - reception and check in staff could have been more proactive in taking luggage and helping with holdings doors open (if not anything else, they're missing out on an easy opportunity to gain a tip!)  - the pool area is poorly laid out, and the result is that there's very few beds considering the size of the hotel. I was going to write a good review, as the staff were friendly, the food was good, and the pool was excellent. I was there for 4 nights and spent the whole time at the pool, so it was hard not to enjoy that part of the experience. The only annoying thing about the hotel was the elevators, which took ages to come, and often didn't stop at your floor, even when you pressed the button.  But after I checked out, and have since flown home, I have been contacted privately by two members of staff because my bill was calculated wrong, and the money was taken out of their wages.   The way I was contacted (privately on WhatsApp) made the whole thing seem like a scam, but after messaging the hotel through booking.com, it turns out I was undercharged, by $70 (USD). This is not a 5 star hotel, maybe a 3 star.  The staff are all nice, but this is not well run. Everything feels like a shambles. La Vela Saigon is a lovely place to stay, rooms are quite small in size but comfortable, the view is amazing and the best part is the infinity pool located at top of the building. The property is located in city centre. The breakfast spread is great but only disappointing thing was the breakfast was till 9:00 am. The Houskeeping and the front desk staff is really polite and helpful. They do have a spa and casino in the hotel premises. The spa is great.

Colas de 15 minutos en los ascensores que te desesperan, el desayuno es un desastre de la cantidad de gente que hay. Faltan mucha comida por reponer constantemente, los empleados no dan abasto. El hotel y la piscina son muy bonitos pero hay tanta gente que es un caos y un estrÃ©s. La verdad no lo recomiendo en absoluto.

There is no space for keeping luggage. So only option is to go for Bigger rooms/ suites only

Very fast travelling from the airport to the hotel, easy transportation by using Grabs, FamilyMart's nearby and breakfast is good, including cereals, either Eastern or Western choices, with relaxing top levels views.

English:  This hotel is not a 5 star hotel.   Hello everyone, I do not like to put this type of comment but for this hotel I had to do it.   This hotel has nothing of a 5 stars.  The service is not up to the mark: the wifi works very poorly, I got intoxicated while eating in one of the restaurants of the hotel, the bar is closed at 10:45 pm, the staff does the minimum

We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. In comparison to other hotels we saw in HCMC it was very modern. The price was very reasonable for 5 star. The rooms were spacious and well decorated. The roofrop pool was a highlight and had an amazing view of the city. There was a huge selection of food for breakfast. Staff were friendly.  There were however some negatives. The sound insulation in the rooms is poor and you can hear even the TV in the next room. There is only a handful of beds at the pool and it's impossible to get one. A la carte food is overpriced and not a great standard. It feels like it is missing something that a 5 star should have. We felt it was closer to a 4 star hotel. It was not that clean and the finishes were not up to 5 star standard.

h_title_comment: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at

Super nice food and good breakfast as well, friendly staff and overall good service,. Pool 10/10, English 5/10. Been here 2 months and will stay another 3, will come again for sure.Also good location if you want to explore surrounding areas.

Do not bother, the service is awful!   Using the lifts takes forever and a day. Ordered room service and found a hair in it. This hotel is definitely not worth it, the only thing it has going for itself is the rooftop pool and view but other than that - donâ€™t waste your money!

The pool is beautiful but everything else is a letdown. Poor customer service during breakfast service and around the poolbar. Inattentive staff and wrong food/drink orders. I wasn't impressed with the quality of our room and it felt way below the standards of other 5* hotel rooms in the city. A lot of the food at breakfast was stuck under heatlamps for hours so it was lukewarm and very uneappealing. A very lacklustre experience. This is not a 5* hotel.

- Reception at check-in should make their guests aware that parking is free. Concierge should be taking bags up to the rooms for guests. - Our room smelled musty. There were cigarette burns on the carpet near the window and a big stain. The windows weren't soundproofed enough so you could hear every motorbike horn outside. No tables or chairs on the balcony to enjoy it. Extremely difficult to maneuver out of the door to get to the balcony which seemed like a massive design-flaw. The TV's in the rooms seemed cheap (the picture/sound quality wasn't great) and not up to standard for a 5 star hotel. Pros: big rooftop pool with panaroma view of Saigon Cons: room is small, corridor is dark, cigarette smell and stuffy, toilet room design is not nice with electric curtain. So waiter suggested to come to my room to take cash immediately.

I've stayed at this hotel 3 times now.  Each time there was something not quite right. The keycard broke off in the door slot.  They gave me the wrong room....with no apology.  The toilet didn't work.  The safe stuffed up locking my valuables...needed to be reset. They don't give conditioner bottles...i asked but they just gave me more shampoo.  English amongst staff is poor...i don't have that issue in other hotels in HCMC. I know its sounds fickle...but it's these little things that should be more professional.  I think everyone goes for the pool which is amazing and is why i go there.......but not again....better hotels in HCMC which look after customers...at a much better price. Without the pool...this hotel would suffer....they know that.  You just feel like you're another

h_title_comment: Nice hotel  from outside but poor  management and very poor rooms
h_comment: First of all i was very happy to stay in this hotel !! Mr Dat the head of reception was so nice during my booking that i was exited to have a nice weekend!! But arriving at the floor the corridor was dark and feel like poor local hotel . In the room all buttons ON/OFF is near the entrance door which mean if you need to used the bathroom go to your door first !!  No plug in to used the laptop , i have to unplug the television and be carefull because  high risk of shock yourself.  I wish to book for the dimsun buffet but was not welcome by the girl on the phone who wanted to charge full price for a 3 years old baby !! She argue on the phone that was the policy if the kids is higher than 1m !! Girl you are working in hospitality & services not in an administration !!  Very bad

I put 1 extra star for the infinitive pool and the rooftop bar. They are beautiful.   The room is quite small. The service is totally terrible. What they advertised on facebook is a scam, there's nothing like "all you can eat" or anything alike. They served me old dimsum (or they didn't really want to serve me at all!).   There was clear discrimination in the way they treat expats and Vietnamese. When I complained, I didn't receive even a sorry from anyone.   I will never ever come back.

The staff were polite and pleasant but service was slow and disorganised. Breakfast and dinner were terrible. Lunch was ok. Checkout took 30 minutes even though they were visibly not busy. The rooftop pool is amazing but thatâ€™s the only reason the hotel is rated 5 stars on booking.com.

This hotel has so much potential but unfortunately doesnâ€™t really live up to its 5* billing. The staff are very nice and always willing to help but itâ€™s the design flaws that let it down. The rooms are no where near 5* and having stayed here twice in two different types of room, both have the same strange layout where itâ€™s very difficult to get in and out of the bathroom and also to get in and out of the shower. The toilet in so close to the wall in front of the shower itâ€™s very odd.  The main draw of this place is the rooftop pool, which is stunning and definitely worth a visit. I cannot find any account in tripadvisor under Mermaid Restaurant which is their Seafood Buffet. Anyway, I will echo my feedback here about our disappointing dinner experience. We knew about their seafood buffet through their paid post in facebook and immediately we were attracted on their offers. Very reasonable price and beautiful seafood images particularly lobsters; our favorite! As the saying goes â€œa picture is worth a thousand wordsâ€ so we chose this venue to celebrate my girlfriendâ€™s birthday Aug 09, 2020.  The place is at the 25th floor. They have indoor and outdoor sitting areas and we chose to stay indoor since it was raining. The lighting was too bright and they use white color lights.
